data.question: 1. Which institution is to set up the ‘Corporate Debt Market Development Fund’?
data.hint:
Notes:SEBI decided to set up a corporate debt market development fund in the form of an Alternative Investment Fund.
Corporate Debt Market Development Fund will be set up with an initial corpus of Rs 3,000 crore. It will function as a backstop facility for buying investment grade corporate debt securities during stressful times.

data.question: 2. ‘Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Voice’ is associated with which country?
data.hint:
Notes:First Peoples of Australia are people who lived in the Australia’s continental mainland and surrounding islands for tens of thousands of years before the arrival of first Europeans in the early 17th century.
A referendum will be issued this year by the Australian government to alter the Constitution to recognise the First Peoples of Australia by establishing an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Voice. It will decide whether these people should be formally consulted in the law making process.

data.question: 3. World Health Organisation (WHO) certified which countries as Malaria-free recently?
options: [A] India and Sri Lanka[B] Azerbaijan and Tajikistan[C] Pakistan and Afghanistan[D] Nepal and Bangladesh
data.hint:
Notes:Recently, the World Health Organisation certified Azerbaijan and Tajikistan as Malaria-Free Countries.
They succeeded in eliminating the Anopheles mosquito-borne disease in their territories. In Tajikistan and Azerbaijan, the last cases of regional spread of Plasmodium vivax malaria were discovered in 2012 and 2014.

data.question: 4. IMF’s Extended Fund Facility has been reently approved for which country?
data.hint: Notes:The International Monetary Fund’s Extended Fund Facility is intended for countries experiencing serious medium-term BoP issues due to structural weakness that require time to address. It was recently approved for Ukraine to meet the urgent funding requirements amid the war with Russia.

data.question: 5. ‘Schengen area’ is associated with which association?
data.hint:
Notes:The EU members have recently decided to digitize the Schengen Visa to make visa application process more efficient in Schengen area.
The Schengen area is a region comprising of 27 EU countries that have officially abolished all passports and other types of border control at their mutual borders.

data.question: 6. Hexacentrus ashoka, which was seen in the news, belongs to which species?
data.hint:
Notes:Three new species of bush cricket was found recently. Two of these species (Hexacentrus tiddae and Hexacentrus ashoka) were found in Haryana. In the local dialect of Haryana, bush crickets are referred to as tiddaes.
The third species found in Meghalaya was named Hexacentrus khasiensis — after the Khasi hills where it was discovered.

data.question: 7. Which country’s plant mycologist is the first person in the world to contract a plant fungal disease?
data.hint:
Notes:‘Chondrostereum purpureum’ is a plant fungus that causes silver leaf disease in plants. A plant mycologist from India has become the first person in the world to contract a plant fungal disease.
It attacks most species of the rose family Rosaceae, particularly the genus Prunus. Among the millions of fungi present, only a few hundreds of fungi infect humans and animals.

data.question: 8. What is the GST collection recorded in the month of March?
options: [A] Rs 1.5 lakh crore[B] Rs 1.6 lakh crore[C] Rs 1.8 lakh crore[D] Rs 2 lakh crore
data.hint:
Notes:India’s Goods and Services Tax (GST) revenue collection for the month of March 2023 is stood at 1.6 lakh crore rupees.
This is 13 percent higher than the GST revenues in the same month of last year. It is for the fourth time, in the current financial year that the gross GST collection has crossed 1.5 lakh crore rupees, since the implementation of GST.

data.question: 9. Which country launched the ‘Ukraine Security Assistance Initiative’?
data.hint:
Notes:Ukraine Security Assistance Initiative was launched by the US to increase Ukraine’s capacity to defend itself from Russia’s aggression.
Under this initiative, USD 2.6 billion military aid package was announced by the US.  USAI is an authority under which the United States procures capabilities from industry.

data.question: 10. Which is the headquarters of the ‘Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC)’?
data.hint:
Notes:Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) was founded in 1969 to protect the interests of the Muslim world.
The Indian government recently criticised the OIC after the organization’s secretariat issued statement alleging the targeting of Muslim community in several states during Ram Navami processions.

data.question: 11. Which country has invited Prime Minister to visit as a guest at the annual Bastille Day parade?
data.hint:
Notes:France has invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit Paris as a guest at the annual Bastille Day parade in July.
The Prime Minister and French President Emmanuel Macron are expected to discuss a number of major agreements including those on the Indo-Pacific region, nuclear power and defence, as the two countries mark the 25 th year of their strategic partnership.

data.question: 12. Which institution released the ‘World Energy Transitions: Outlook 2023’ report?
options: [A] International Renewable Energy Agency[B] International Monetary Fund[C] World Bank[D] United Nations Environment Programme
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: A [International Renewable Energy Agency]
data.hint:
Notes:The “World Energy Transitions: Outlook 2023” Report was released recently by the International Renewable Energy Agency.
According to this report, while significant progress has been made towards increasing renewable energy generation, the global energy transition is still falling short of the 1.5°C pathway.

data.question: 13. Habrocestum togansangmai, a new species discovered, belongs to which species?
data.hint:
Notes:Four new species of jumping spiders were recently discovered from the Meghalaya. One among them is ‘Habrocestum togansangmai’.
It is named after Garo freedom fighter Togan Sangma.

data.question: 14. Union Information and Broadcasting Ministry signed agreement with which company to boost India’s creative economy?
data.hint:
Notes:The Information and Broadcasting Ministry and Amazon India have signed a collaboration agreement in New Delhi to boost India’s creative economy and promote creative talent in the country.
As part of the agreement, Amazon Prime Video will sponsor scholarships, create internship programmes, and offer job opportunities for students of the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) and Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute.

data.question: 15. The ‘Stand Up India Scheme’ has been extended till which year?
data.hint:
Notes:The Stand up India Scheme was launched in 2016 to promote entrepreneurship focusing on economic empowerment and job creation. The scheme has been extended till 2025.
Over Rs 40,700 crore was sanctioned under the Stand Up India Scheme over the seven years of its implementation. Around 80 percent of the loans under this scheme were provided to women.

data.question: 16. ‘Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project’ is located in which Indian state?
data.hint:
Notes:Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project involves the setting up of India’ largest nuclear power station in Tirunelveli district of Tamil Nadu.
A pressuriser was delivered for Reactor 5 of this power plant by AEM-Technologies Izhora, which is part of the machine-building division of Rosatom – Atomenergomash.

data.question: 17. Which country signed several economic agreements in energy, agriculture among other sectors, with China?
data.hint:
Notes:France and China have signed several economic agreements involving major companies in sectors such as transport, energy, agriculture, culture and science during President Emmanuel Macron’s trip to China.
One of the deals will create a new assembly line in French aircraft manufacturer Airbus’ Tianjin factory so the company can double its production capacity of A320 models.

data.question: 18. UAE signed declaration with which country to begin talks on Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement?
data.hint:
Notes:The United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Vietnam have signed a joint declaration of intent to launch talks on establishing a comprehensive economic partnership agreement (CEPA) between the two countries.
The UAE is Vietnam’s largest trade partner in the Arab countries, accounting for 39% of its total trade, and the volume of non-oil trade between the two countries reached USD 8 billion in 2022.

data.question: 19. ‘Prasthan Exercise’ the bi-annual coordinated exercise, held near which city in 2023?
data.hint:
Notes:Prasthan Exercise is a bi-annual coordinated exercise held among Indian defence, state and civilian agencies twice a year.
It was conducted recently in the offshore development area off Mumbai. It validates the measures to address contingencies that may occur in oil production platforms.

data.question: 20. Which Union Ministry appointed the ‘Committee on Digital Competition Law’?
options: [A] Ministry of Finance[B] Ministry of Corporate Affairs[C] Ministry of External Affairs[D] Ministry of Corporate Affairs
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: D [Ministry of Corporate Affairs]
data.hint:
Notes:The Ministry of Corporate Affairs had appointed 10-Member Committee on Digital Competition Law, consisting of lawyers representing the Big Tech.
It is set to meet shortly to discuss provisions of the draft Digital Competition Law. The committee is responsible for examining the need for an ex-ante regulatory mechanism for digital markets via a separate legislation.

data.question: 21. ‘Tropospheric Emissions Monitoring of Pollution Instrument’ is a device of which space agency?
data.hint:
Notes:Tropospheric Emissions Monitoring of Pollution Instrument is a new NASA device that will track pollution over North America.
It will enable scientists to monitor air pollutants and their sources from space. The spectrometer designed to measure air pollution across greater North America at a high resolution and on an hourly basis.

data.question: 22. ‘AlUla Declaration’, which was seen in the news, is related to which country?
data.hint:
Notes:A fourth joint meeting between the delegates of the UAE and Qatar was held in Abu Dhabi to follow up on the implementation of the AlUla Declaration.
The AlUla Declaration, which was signed in 2021, resolved the dispute with Qatar and called for unity and the strengthening of relations among GCC countries.

data.question: 23. Which NBFC firm has raised USD 750 million through issuance of green bonds?
options: [A] REC[B] PFC[C] Bajaj Finance[D] Aditya Birla Finance
data.hint:
Notes:State-owned non-banking finance firm REC recently raised USD 750 million through issuance of green bonds
The net proceeds from the issue of the bonds will be applied to finance, in whole or in part, the eligible green projects in accordance with the approvals granted by the Reserve Bank of India from time to time and in accordance with the ECB guidelines.

data.question: 24. Which state/UT launched the ‘Directorate of Paribar’  to have better connect with the people of the state within country and across the world?
options: [A] West Bengal[B] Odisha[C] Andhra Pradesh[D] Karnataka
data.hint:
Notes:The establishment of the Directorate of Odisha Paribar was approved recently by the state cabinet. It will be the one-stop point of contact and support system for Odias dwelling in other parts of India and across the world.
The Directorate of Odisha Parivar will be under the Department of Odia Language, Literature and Culture to have better connect with Pravasi Odias within the country and across the world.

data.question: 25. As per the 5th Cycle of India’s Tiger Census, how many tigers are in India, as of 2023?
data.hint:
Notes:The 5th Cycle of India’s Tiger Census was released recently by Prime Minister Modi. This census revealed that India’s tiger population stands at 3,167 in the wild.
This figure is 200 more than it had four years ago. India is estimated to have more than 70% of the world’s tigers.

data.question: 26. Dogri language is prevalently spoken in which state/UT?
options: [A] West Bengal[B] Assam[C] Jammu and Kashmir[D] Telangana
data.hint:
Notes:Dogri is an Indo-Aryan language primarily spoken in the Jammu region of Jammu and Kashmir. Union Minister of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs, Kiren Rijiju released the first edition of the Dogri version of the Constitution of India at University of Jammu.
Dogri language was added in the 8th Schedule of the Constitution back in 2003.

data.question: 27. As per a recent report of the NSO, what per centage of communicable disease deaths in 2021 was due to respiratory ailments?
data.hint:
Notes:As per the latest data released by National Statistical Office (NSO), the share of respiratory infections in deaths caused by communicable diseases rose by 10 per cent to 78 per cent in 2021 from 68 per cent in 2020,
This means about four out of five deaths due to communicable diseases were caused by the respiratory ailments.

data.question: 28. Which city is the host of the ‘Third Regional Symposium on Greening the Judiciaries’?
options: [A] New York[B] Nairobi[C] New Delhi[D] Dhaka
data.hint:
Notes:The Third Regional Symposium on Greening the Judiciaries in Africa was organized by the Africa Judicial Education Network on Environmental Law (AJENEL) in Nairobi, Kenya.
It was held based on the theme ‘Strengthening the Role of Judiciaries in Addressing Climate Change in Africa’.

data.question: 29. Which state/UT has organised the ‘Baisakhi Mahotsav 2023’?
options: [A] Andhra Pradesh[B] Jammu and Kashmir[C] Kerala[D] Odisha
data.hint:
Notes:Baisakhi Mahotsav 2023 will be organized by Jammu’s Directorate of Tourism. The event celebrates Dogra culture and heritage.
Baisakhi, also known as Vaisakhi, is one of the harvest festivals celebrated in India and in parts of the world largely by the Sikh community.

data.question: 30. Which Indian chess player has won the World Chess Armageddon Asia & Oceania?
options: [A] R Praggnanandhaa[B] D Gukesh[C] Arjun Erigaisi[D] Nihal Sarin
data.hint:
Notes:Teenaged Indian Grandmaster D Gukesh stunned former world rapid champion Nodirbek Abdusattorov of Uzbekistan in the final to win the World Chess Armageddon Asia & Oceania.
The 16-year-old Indian won in a field that included former world classical champion Vladimir Kramnik, Daniil Dubov, Yangyi Yu (China), Vidit Gujrathi and Karthikeyan Murali (both India) and Param Maghsoodloo (Iran), apart from Abdusattorov.

data.question: 31. ‘Experimental Advanced Superconducting Tokamak (EAST) fusion energy reactor’ is located in which country?
data.hint:
Notes:Experimental Advanced Superconducting Tokamak (EAST) fusion energy reactor is located in Hefei, China.
The reactor has set a new record by creating an artificial sun that sustained plasma for 403 seconds. This broke the 2017 record of 101 seconds.

data.question: 32. ‘Pohela Boishakh’ marks the beginning of the new year in which state?
data.hint:
Notes:Pohela Boishakh, also known as Bengali New Year, is a significant cultural festival in Bangladesh and the Bengali-speaking states of India including West Bengal.
The festival is celebrated on the first day of the Bengali calendar, which usually falls in the month of April. This year, it is celebrated on April 15.

data.question: 33. Which bloc has set up a set up a task force to monitor OpenAI’s ChatGPT?
data.hint:
Notes:The European Data Protection Board is an autonomous institute in charge of supervising data protection regulations within the European Union.
It has recently decided to set up a task force to monitor Open AI’s ChatGPT. Italy last month imposed a temporarily ban on ChatGPT.

data.question: 34. The ‘Bharat Gaurav Tourist train’ was flagged off to mark birth anniversary of which leader in April?
options: [A] Jawaharlal Nehru[B] Dr B R Ambedkar[C] Subash Chandra Bose[D] Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: B [Dr B R Ambedkar]
data.hint:
Notes:Union Tourism Minister G Krishan Reddy and Social Justice and Empowerment Minister Dr. Virendra Kumar flagged off Bharat Gaurav Tourist train to mark the birth anniversary of Dr B R Ambedkar from New Delhi.
Government has developed Panchteerth, five place associated with Dr Ambedkar. During the 8-day tour, the train will cover cities including, New Delhi, Mhow, Nagpur, Varanasi and sacred Buddhist sites like Sanchi, Sarnath, Gayaand Rajgir and Nalanda.

data.question: 35. ‘Nagarjunasagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve’ is located in a region spanning across which states?
options: [A] Tamil Nadu- Kerala[B] Andhra Pradesh -Telangana[C] Andhra Pradesh- Tamil Nadu[D] Maharashtra- Karnataka
data.hint:
Notes:Nagarjunasagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve is the largest tiger reserve in India, spanning across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.
To ensure smooth traffic flow, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has enabled FASTag-based payments at forest entry points across Nagarjunasagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve (NSTR).

data.question: 36. ‘Cheiraoba’ is a festival celebrated in which state?
data.hint:
Notes:Cheiraoba is considered to be one of the most important festivals of Manipur and it marks the beginning of the lunar new year for the people of Meitei community of Manipur and across the globe.
The festival is also called as Sajibu Nongma Pānba which means “First day of Sajibu Month”.

data.question: 37. What is ‘RAMBAAN’, which was recently seen in the news?
options: [A] Elephant Species[B] Mobile Clinic[C] COVID vaccine[D] Launch Vehicle
data.hint:
Notes:RAMBAAN (Rapid Action Mobile BSL3+ Advanced Augmented Network) is India’s first mobile BSL-3 laboratory.
It was showcased at the second G20 Health Working Group Meeting, which was organized in Goa. This fully equipped, Made-in-India mobile clinic can reach remote regions to conduct testing.

data.question: 38. Which institution launched the ‘State of World Population’ Report?
data.hint:
Notes:The State of World Population report titled ‘8 Billion Lives, Infinite Possibilities’ was released recently by the United Nations Population Fund.
According to this report released by UNFPA, India is now the most populous country in the world, as it has surpassed China’s population numbers.

data.question: 39. Scientists of which institution have recently identified Electromagnetic Ion Cyclotron (EMIC) waves?
options: [A] Indian Space Research Organisation[B] IIT – Madras[C] Indian Antarctic station[D] National Institute of Ocean Technology
data.hint:
Notes:The Scientists of Indian Antarctic station, Maitri, have recently identified and studied the characteristics of Electromagnetic Ion Cyclotron (EMIC) waves, which are a form of plasma waves.
These waves are said to play an important role in precipitation of killer electrons (electrons having speed close to speed of light, which form the radiation belt of planet Earth), which are hazardous to our space-borne technology and instruments.

data.question: 40. ‘Hanuman Plover Bird’ is a species endemic to which countries?
options: [A] India and Sri Lanka[B] USA and Canada[C] Australia and New Zealand[D] Japan and Indonesia
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: A [India and Sri Lanka]
data.hint:
Notes:Hanuman Plover Bird has been reinstated as species after more than eight decades. This bird is endemic to India and Sri Lanka.
Hanuman Plover Bird was merged with the Kentish plover in the 1930s as both species were considered to be the same.

data.question: 41. Which institution released the ‘The State of the World’s Children 2023: For Every Child, Vaccination’ report?
options: [A] UNICEF[B] NITI Aayog[C] Women and Child Development Ministry[D] Pratham Foundation
data.hint:
Notes:‘The State of the World’s Children 2023: For Every Child, Vaccination’ report was released recently by the UNICEF India.
According to this report, India is one of the countries with highest vaccine confidence in the world. The popular perception of the importance of vaccines for children held firm or improved only in China, India and Mexico out of 55 countries studied.

data.question: 42. ‘Safe Kerala Project’ which was launched recently, aims to minimise?
options: [A] Honour Killings[B] Road Accidents[C] Covid Deaths[D] Cardiac Arrests
data.hint:
Notes:The state government of Kerala launched the Safe Kerala Project to minimize the number of on-road accidents and prevent traffic violations in the state.
As part of this project, Artificial Intelligence-based cameras will be used to identify traffic violations and impose fines.

data.question: 43. ‘Mission Youth’, which received the PM Award for Excellence under Innovation Category, is from which state/UT?
options: [A] Karnataka[B] Jammu and Kashmir[C] Odisha[D] Jharkhand
data.hint:
Notes:The Jammu and Kashmir administration’s flagship initiative, ‘Mission Youth’ recently received the Prime Minister’s Award for Excellence under the Innovation (state) category.
It is a unique programme aimed at empowering youth in the union territory. The mission will focus on all individuals between the age of 15 to 35 years.

data.question: 44. Fort Dansborg (Danish Fort), which was seen in the news, is located in which state/UT?
data.hint:
Notes:Fort Dansborg, also known as the Danish Fort, was built in 1620 at the eastern coastal village of Tharangambadi.
The Tamil Nadu state tourism department has sanctioned Rs.3 crore to conduct various infrastructure development works at this fort.

data.question: 45. Who is the first woman IAF officer to receive a gallantry medal?
options: [A] Avani Chaturvedi[B] Bhawana Kant[C] Deepika Misra[D] Mohana Singh
data.hint:
Notes:Wing Commander Deepika Misra recently became the first woman Indian Air Force (IAF) officer to receive a gallantry medal.
She received Vayu Seva Medal for gallantry from Indian Air Force chief Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari recently.

data.question: 46. Which Indian Armed Force acquired the ‘Nagastra 1’ an indigenous drone developed in India?
options: [A] Indian Army[B] Indian Navy[C] Indian Air Force[D] Indian Coast Guard
data.hint:
Notes:Nagastra 1 is an indigenous drone developed by the Economic Explosives Limited. It was acquired recently by the Indian Army to increase its operations at the LOC.
Nagastra 1 can strike targets within 15-30 km, using GPS-enabled precision. It is also designed to loiter over enemy territory in search of moving personnel, military vehicles or an enemy position before being taken down.

data.question: 47. Which case is famous for the definition of basic structure of the Indian Constitution?
options: [A] Kesavananda Bharati Case[B] Romesh Thappar Case[C] Shreya Singhal Case[D] Vishakha V Case
data.hint:
Notes:Kesavananda Bharati Case is a landmark case where the Supreme Court defined the basic structure of the Indian Constitution. The judgement for this case was delivered on April 24, 1973.
The case is also known as the Fundamental Rights Case. The Supreme Court asserted its right to strike down amendments to the constitution that were in violation of the fundamental architecture of the constitution.

data.question: 48. When is the ‘National Panchayati Raj Day’ celebrated?
data.hint:
Notes:‘National Panchayati Raj Day’ is celebrated every year on April 24. The Ministry of Panchayati Raj in collaboration with the state Government of Madhya Pradesh is commemorating National Panchayati Raj Day in Madhya Pradesh as part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav – Samaaveshi Vikaas (Inclusive Development).
The Prime Minister was the Chief Guest at the national function.

data.question: 49. Which country recently released the ‘Indo-Pacific Outlook’ document?
data.hint:
Notes:Bangladesh officially unveiled its Indo-Pacific Outlook (IPO) outlining four guiding principles and 15 objectives in the document.
It recognizes the importance of stability and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific for achieving Bangladesh’s Vision 2041.

data.question: 50. ‘Mohammed Shahabuddin’ recently became the President of which country?
data.hint:
Notes:Mohammed Shahabuddin is a veteran freedom fighter, jurist and politician. He recently became the 22nd President of Bangladesh.
Shahabuddin succeeds Abdul Hamid whose tenure ended recently. He was elected as president unopposed in February this year as a candidate of the ruling Awami League.

data.question: 1. Spheroidal carbonaceous particle is a component of?
options: [A] Fly Ash[B] Saw Dust[C] Dry Ice[D] Common Salt
data.hint:
Notes:Spheroidal carbonaceous particle (SCP) is a component of fly ash and is a by-product of industrial high-temperature combustion of coal and fuel-oil.
Recently, researchers from British Antarctic Survey and the University College London, for the first time identified SCP in an Antarctic ice core. The sample dated back to 1936, indicating physical markers of fossil fuel combustion have been trapped in ice layers for decades.

data.question: 2. When is the ‘World Intellectual Property Day’ observed?
data.hint:
Notes:The World Intellectual Property Day is observed every year on April 26. It raises global awareness about intellectual properties and their protection.
The WIPO convention came into effect in 1970 and, in the year 2000, WIPO’s member states declared April 26 as World Intellectual Property.

data.question: 3. Scientists from which country have developed ‘Mobile Vaccine Printer’?
data.hint:
Notes:Mobile vaccine printer is an innovative technology developed by researchers at MIT. This small device is capable of producing hundreds of vaccine doses within a single day.
It has the potential to provide vital vaccines to individuals in remote regions who lack the required resources for conventional vaccine storage and transportation.

data.question: 4. Which institution released a report on ‘Contribution of terrestrial animal source food to healthy diets’?
data.hint:
Notes:The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) recently released a report titled “Contribution of terrestrial animal source food to healthy diets for improved nutrition and health outcomes”.
According to this report, animal food products like meat, eggs and milk can help achieve global nutrition targets.

data.question: 5. Which country has recorded an increase in cases of ‘Klebsiella pneumoniae bacteria’?
data.hint:
Notes:Klebsiella pneumoniae is a gram-negative, lactose-fermenting bacterium capable of causing destruction to the human and animal lungs.
There has been an increase in the number of cases of individuals infected with the Klebsiella pneumoniae in Seattle, US.

data.question: 6. Which country is supplying Mi-17 helicopter engines and auxiliary spare parts to Pakistan?
data.hint:
Notes:Ukraine is launching the process of supplying the Mi-17 helicopter engines and auxiliary spare parts to Pakistan military. Mi-17 is a Soviet-designed military helicopter used for carrying personnel, cargo and equipment.
Pakistan will export three consignments of 155 mm artillery ammunition rounds over the next three months to Ukraine.

data.question: 7. Which is the governing body of the Department of Atomic Energy in India?
options: [A] Atomic Energy Commission of India[B] NITI Aayog[C] Department of Space[D] DRDO
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: A [Atomic Energy Commission of India]
data.hint: Notes:The Atomic Energy Commission of India is the governing body of the Department of Atomic Energy. Recently, BARC Director Ajit Kumar Mohanty was appointed as the chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission and the Secretary of the Department of Atomic Energy.

data.question: 8. ‘Sinthan Festival’ was organised in which state/UT?
options: [A] Jammu and Kashmir[B] Assam[C] West Bengal[D] Karnataka
data.hint:
Notes:The two-day maiden Sinthan Festival was organized recently by the Directorate of Tourism, Jammu in collaboration with the District Administration Kishtwar, Indian Army and Jammu and Kashmir Academy of Art, Culture and Languages.
This festival was held in Kishtwar District of Chenab Valley.

data.question: 9. Which state/UT announced a ‘Summer Action Plan’, which involves the participation of 30 government departments?
data.hint:
Notes:Delhi Chief Minister recently announced a ‘Summer action plan’ to combat air pollution during summer months. It involves the participation of 30 government departments.
The primary focus of the action plan is on dust pollution, which has been a major contributor to the city’s worsening air quality.

data.question: 10. Liberica excelsa, which was seen in the news, belongs to which species?
data.hint:
Notes:Liberica excelsa is a species of coffee that is found to be capable of withstanding heat, drought and disease exacerbated by global warming.
It is being promoted by large coffee exporting countries in Africa as an alternative to Arabica and robusta, which are at risk to climate change.

data.question: 11. King Charles III, who was officially crowned recently, wore which crown?
options: [A] St John’s Crown[B] St Edward’s Crown[C] St Charles’ Crown[D] St Stephen’s Crown
data.hint:
Notes:King Charles III, who was officially crowned alongside Queen Camilla, wore St Edward’s Crown for the historic coronation ceremony.
The 74-year-old royal was officially crowned the UK’s monarch at Westminster Abbey. It is tradition for the monarch to wear the solid gold St Edward’s Crown. The crown dates back hundreds more years – to 1661 when it was made for King Charles II.

data.question: 12. As per the ‘Internet in India Report, what percent of the Indian population accessed the internet at least once a month in 2022?
data.hint:
Notes:Internet in India Report 2022 was released recently by the Internet and Mobile Association of India (IAMAI) and Kantar.
According to this report, around 52 percent of the Indian population accessed the internet at least once a month in 2022.

data.question: 13. Which Union Ministry organised an outreach program called ‘BizAmp’?
options: [A] Ministry of MSME[B] Ministry of Commerce and Industry[C] Ministry of External Affairs[D] Ministry of Sports and Youth Affairs
data.hint:
Notes:The Union Ministry of MSME collaborated with NSIC Venture Capital Fund Limited (NVCFL) to organize an outreach program called BizAmp in Dimapur, Nagaland.
The main objective of this program was to empower MSMEs in the North Eastern States and help them amplify their businesses by utilizing the benefits provided under the Self-Reliant India (SRI) Fund.

data.question: 14. ‘Vaisakh Purnima’ is associated with which religion?
data.hint:
Notes:Vaisakh Purnima is celebrated on 5th May this year. The Union Ministry of Culture will collaborate with the International Buddhist Confederation (IBC) to celebrate this occasion at the National Museum in New Delhi.
Several programmes will be organised in Delhi and across the country to mark the ‘UN Day of Vesak’.

data.question: 15. Which institution released the “Is an End to Child Marriage Within Reach?” report?
data.hint:
Notes:UNICEF recently released a report titled ‘Is an End to Child Marriage Within Reach?’. According to this report, while the rate of child marriage is declining, it is not enough.
The present rate would mean that the practice will continue to exist for 300 more years. About 640 million girls, teens and women were victims of the practice of child marriage.

data.question: 16. Which institution along with Bank for International Settlements (BIS) launched ‘G20 TechSprint’?
data.hint:
Notes:Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and Bank for International Settlements (BIS) launch G20 TechSprint, a global technology competition.
TechSprint will focus on developing innovative technology solutions for cross-border payments. The competition is open for developers around the world.

data.question: 17. How many members are present in the high level committee constituted for Restructuring of ICAR?
data.hint:
Notes:The Government of India has set up a 11-member high-level committee to restructure the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR). The committee will be under the chairmanship of the Additional Secretary of the Department of Agricultural Research and Education and Secretary of ICAR.
The committee has been constituted to make recommendations for rationalising and right-sizing the 94-year-old ICAR.

data.question: 18. MoHUA has signed a MoU with which organisation, for technical assistance under the Swachh Bharat Mission-Urban 2.0?
data.hint:
Notes:Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with RITES Limited for technical assistance for Solid Waste Management (SWM) & Used Water Management UWM under Swachh Bharat Mission-Urban 2.0.
Under this MoU, RITES will help standardise processes and design facilities for solid waste and used water management in towns with a population of below 1 lakh.

data.question: 19. Which is the first state to provide digital health cards for children?
options: [A] Uttar Pradesh[B] Assam[C] West Bengal[D] Rajasthan
data.hint:
Notes:The School Health Program was launched recently by the Urban Development Department and Lucknow Smart City.
This initiative makes Uttar Pradesh the first state in the country to provide digital health cards for children.

data.question: 20. Which military unit is an auxiliary organization with part-time volunteers, who assist the Indian Army?
options: [A] Territorial Army[B] Friends of Army[C] Friends of People[D] Border Volunteers
data.hint:
Notes:The Territorial Army, a military unit in India, is an auxiliary organization with part-time volunteers who provide assistance to the Indian Army.
Defence Minister Rajnath Singh recently approved the posting of women officers of the TA with Engineer Regiments along the LOC and as staff officers at TA Group Headquarters/ Directorate General of Territorial Army at New Delhi.

data.question: 21. ‘Operation Trinetra’ was conducted in which state/ UT?
options: [A] West Bengal[B] Uttarakhand[C] Jammu and Kashmir[D] Punjab
data.hint:
Notes:Operation Trinetra is a massive search operation that was launched to hunt down terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri.
During this operation, a total of five soldiers lost their lives. It was conducted by the Indian Army along with the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) and Jammu and Kashmir Police.

data.question: 22. What is ‘Cordyceps Sinensis’?
data.hint:
Notes:Cordyceps Sinensis, locally called yarchagumba, is a parasitic fungus that grows on the body of a caterpillar.
It is harvested by villagers in Nepal and Tibet to be sold in neighbouring China, where it is used in herbal medicines.

data.question: 23. ‘PMJJBY, PMSBY and APY’ were launched in which year?
data.hint:
Notes:Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMJJBY), Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMSBY) and Atal Pension Yojana (APY) have completed eight years. They were launched in 2015.
Till date, PMJJBY recorded more than 16 crore enrolments, PMSBY recorded more than 34 crore enrolments and APY recorded around 5 crore subscribers.

data.question: 24. Which Union Ministries organised the ‘ECHO Exhibition’?
options: [A] Women and Child Development-External Affairs Ministry[B] Health and Family Welfare- MSME Ministry[C] Jal Shakti- Housing and Urban Affairs Ministry[D] Home Affairs- Defence Ministry
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: A [Women and Child Development-External Affairs Ministry]
data.hint:
Notes:ECHO (Economy with safe climate and health leads to greater opportunities) exhibition was organized by the Ministry of Women and Child Development in collaboration with the Ministry of External Affairs.
It was organized at the sidelines of the 3rd Development Working Group (DWG) meeting of G-20.

data.question: 25. Which space agency has developed the ‘Aeolus Satellite’?
data.hint:
Notes:Aeolus Satellite is one of the most effective weather satellites developed by the ESA. It is currently on a trajectory to return to Earth’s atmosphere.
Aeolus, an Earth Explorer research mission, was designed to demonstrate new space technology. The 1360-kilogram satellite is on its way to crash on the planet.

data.question: 26. Which country is set to provide 1.2 billion USD more to Ukraine as a part of its Security Assistance Initiative?
data.hint:
Notes:As part of the Ukraine Security Assistance Initiative, the US will provide 1.2 billion USD more in long-term military aid to Ukraine.
It will help Kyiv strengthen its air defences against Russia’s attacks.

data.question: 27. IIT Madras has developed the ‘Piezoelectric MEMS Technology’, along with which institution?
data.hint:
Notes:The piezoelectric MEMS technology has been jointly developed by researchers at DRDO and IIT Madras.
This sensor technology has the potential to be used for underwater communications by the Indian Navy.

data.question: 28. Which racing driver won the Miami Grand Prix title in 2023?
options: [A] Charles Leclerc[B] Max Verstappen[C] Sergio Perez[D] Lewis Hamilton
data.hint:
Notes:Max Verstappen won the Miami Grand Prix from ninth on the starting grid, with the fastest lap.
Mexica’s Perez came second while Fernando Alonso came third. Verstappen was also the winner of last year’s inaugural Miami Grand Prix.

data.question: 29. Which Union Ministry launched the ‘Harit Sagar Guidelines 2023’?
options: [A] Ministry of Jal Shakti[B] Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways[C] Ministry of External Affairs[D] Ministry of Commerce and Industry
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: B [Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways]
data.hint:
Notes:Harit Sagar Guidelines 2023 was unveiled recently by the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways. It envisions Ecosystem Dynamics in port development, operation and maintenance.
It lays emphasis on use of Clean / Green energy in Port operation, developing Port capabilities for storage, handling and bunkering Greener Fuels.

data.question: 30. Fossil remains of a giant pilosaur was discovered in which country recently?
data.hint:
Notes:Fossil remains of a giant pilosaur was discovered in England recently. Pilosaur is a marine reptile that was a distant cousin of modern turtles.
Fossilised bones from the gigantic sea creature that lived 150 million years ago have been found in a drawer at Oxfordshire’s Abingdon County Hall Museum.

data.question: 31. ‘RAMP programme’ is associated with which Union Ministry?
options: [A] Ministry of Textiles[B] Ministry of MSME[C] Ministry of Power[D] Ministry of Culture
data.hint:
Notes:The RAMP programme aims at improving access to market and credit of MSMEs, improving Centre-State linkages and addressing issues of delayed payments of MSMEs.
The first meeting of the National MSME Council was organized by the MSME ministry. It was set up to function as an administrative body that oversee coordination between central ministries/departments, and monitor progress on reforms including the RAMP programme.

data.question: 32. ‘OFDA 4000’ is a state-of-art equipment, which has been procured by which state/UT?
options: [A] Arunachal Pradesh[B] Jammu and Kashmir[C] Rajasthan[D] Gujarat
data.hint:
Notes:The OFDA 4000 is a cutting-edge equipment capable of testing the authenticity of Pashmina. It was procured recently by Handicrafts and Handloom Department Kashmir.
The equipment is capable of testing more than 40000 fibres in less than a minute and can determine such characteristics of the fibre.

data.question: 33. Which Union Ministry launched a learning management information system -SAKSHAM?
options: [A] Ministry of MSME[B] Ministry of Health and Family Welfare[C] Ministry of Commerce and Industry[D] Ministry of Education
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: B [Ministry of Health and Family Welfare]
data.hint:
Notes:Union Health Ministry launched a learning management information system SAKSHAM-Stimulating Advanced Knowledge for Sustainable Health Management.
Healthcare workers and administrators can utilise SAKSHAM to acquire globally relevant knowledge.

data.question: 34. ‘Big Ben’ is the famous clock located in which country?
data.hint:
Notes:Big Ben is the nickname given to the Great Bell of the Great Clock of Westminster, United Kingdom. It had failed to bong on May 10, when the dials of the clock on top of the Elizabeth Tower briefly stopped.
For hundreds of years, it was called the Clock Tower, and was renamed Elizabeth Tower in 2012 to mark the Diamond Jubilee of Elizabeth II.

data.question: 35. The invasion of a tiny insect named ‘Eretmoptera murphyi’ is changing the ecosystem of which continent?
data.hint:
Notes:Eretmoptera murphyi is a flightless midge. It is currently changing Antarctica’s Signy Island soil and ecosystem by feasting on dead organic matter.
It has led to faster plant decomposition, thus increasing the soil nitrate levels by three-five times compared to places on the island where the midge is absent.

data.question: 36. Who is the first Indian scientist to become the Fellow of the Royal Society this year?
options: [A] Rajeev Varshney[B] Ranjit Kher[C] Rajendra Singh[D] Ratna Sagar
data.hint:
Notes:Rajeev Varshney is an Indian agricultural scientist known for his contribution towards decoding legumes’ genomes and developing new varieties of chickpeas.
He is the only new Indian scientist to become the Fellow of the Royal Society this year. Rajeev Varshney is fourth Indian agricultural scientist to become FRS.

data.question: 37. Which institution released the ‘World Tourism Barometer’ Report?
data.hint:
Notes:World Tourism Organization is a specialized agency of the United Nations. According to the second UNWTO World Tourism Barometer of the year, international tourism is rebounding to pre-pandemic levels.
Around 235 million tourists travelled internationally in the first three months of 2023. Overall, international arrivals reached 80% of pre-pandemic levels in the first quarter of 2023.

data.question: 38. Amy Pope, the first woman Director General of the International Organization for Migration, is from which country?
data.hint:
Notes:Amy Pope of the United States was recently elected as the direct general of the International Organization for Migration.
She is the first woman to take up this position in the organisation in its more than 70-year-old history. USA is the largest bilateral donor of the International Organization for Migration.

data.question: 39. Which institution released the ‘Spring 2023 Economic Forecast’?
options: [A] World Bank[B] European Commission[C] WEF[D] IMF
data.hint:
Notes:The ‘Spring 2023 Economic Forecast’ was released recently by the European Commission. It revised the 2023-24 growth outlook of 20 countries with the Euro as their currency to 1.1 percent from the previous estimate of 0.9 percent.
As per the report, lower energy prices, abating supply constraints and a strong labour market supported moderate growth in the first quarter of 2023.

data.question: 40. ‘AutoGrow Project’ is implemented by which institutions?
options: [A] IIHR and IITB[B] IIHR and IITM[C] ICAR and IITB[D] ICAR and IITM
data.hint:
Notes:AutoGrow Project is implemented jointly by the Indian Institute of Horticultural Research (IIHR) and Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IITB).
Under this project, an automated greenhouse system is developed for precision in agriculture.  The system has three configurations; hydroponics, open grow farming, and vertical setup.

data.question: 41. Dal Lake, which was seen in the news, is located in which state/UT?
options: [A] Assam[B] Jammu and Kashmir[C] Karnataka[D] Uttarakhand
data.hint:
Notes:Dal Lake is the second largest lake in Jammu and Kashmir. CRPF recently conducted a special drill in this lake as part of security preparedness ahead of the G20 summit in Kashmir.
Marine Commandos (MORCOS) have also done similar security drills in Dal Lake. The G20 international summit in Kashmir was held from May 22 to May 24 at Sher-e-Kashmir International Conference Centre (SKICC) on the banks of Dal Lake.

data.question: 42. What is the sixth submarine of the first batch of six Kalvari-class submarines for the Indian Navy?
data.hint:
Notes:The sixth submarine of the first batch of six Kalvari-class submarines for the Indian Navy under Project-75 is Vaghsheer.
The submarine is expected to be delivered to the Indian Navy in early 2024. The submarine was launched in 2022 by Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited (MDL).

data.question: 43. What is the name of the central programme launched to promote artificial intelligence in India and beyond?
data.hint:
Notes:INDIAai is a central programme launched to promote artificial intelligence in India and beyond.  The National AI Portal of India is a joint venture by MEITY, NEGD and NASSCOM.
Seven working groups set up under INDIAai are expected to submit their recommendations for a comprehensive framework governing various facets of AI in the near future.

data.question: 44. Kambalakonda Wildlife Sanctuary is located in which state?
options: [A] Kerala[B] Karnataka[C] Andhra Pradesh[D] West Bengal
data.hint:
Notes:Kambalakonda Wildlife Sanctuary is located near Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. Barkudia limbless skink has been spotted recently at the Kambalakonda Wildlife Sanctuary.
It is a small reptile known for its unique limbless body and adaptation capability.

data.question: 45. Which state is set to build the ‘Maharana Pratap Lok’?
options: [A] Maharashtra[B] Madhya Pradesh[C] Assam[D] West Bengal
data.hint:
Notes:Maharana Pratap Lok will be built by the Madhya Pradesh government. The ‘Veer Shiromani Maharana Pratap Lok’ will be constructed in Bhopal.
It will be set up in memory of the Rajput King of Mewar Maharana Pratap. The Chief Minister also declared Maharana Pratap’s birth anniversary as holiday in the state.

data.question: 46. Which Article allows the President to promulgate the ordinance during recess of the Parliament?
data.hint:
Notes:Article 123 of the Indian Constitution allows the President to promulgate the ordinance during recess of the Parliament. The ordinance has the same force and effect as the Act of Parliament.
President of India exercised legislative power under Article 123 of the Constitution, during the period Parliament was in recess, to promulgate The Government of National Capital Territory of Delhi (Amendment) Ordinance, 2023 (Ordinance).

data.question: 47. Which super-computer was ranked at 75th position at Top 500 Global Supercomputing List?
data.hint:
Notes:AIRAWAT is an AI supercomputer in the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC), Pune. It is India’s largest and fastest AI supercomputing system, with a remarkable speed of 13,170 teraflops.
It was ranked at 75th position in the world by the 61st edition of Top 500 Global Supercomputing List. The supercomputer has been installed this year.

data.question: 48. ‘Gerald R. Ford’ the largest aircraft carrier in the world, is located in which country?
data.hint:
Notes:USS Gerald R. Ford is the largest aircraft carrier in the world. It recently made its first foreign call.
The ship is named after the 38th President of the United States, Gerald Ford. The ship sailed into Oslo, a first for such a U.S. ship, in a show of NATO force at a time of heightened tension between NATO and Russia over the war in Ukraine.

data.question: 49. Tina Turner, which was seen in the news, was associated with which profession?
data.hint:
Notes:Tina Turner, a famous American musician, recently passed away at the age of 83. She is the first African-American woman rock-and-roll artist.
Turner announced her retirement in 2000, a year after releasing her final solo album, Twenty Four Seven. Her autobiography ‘My Love Story’ was released in 2018.

data.question: 50. El Popo Volcano, which was seen in the news, is located in which country?
data.hint:
Notes:Popocatepetl, commonly known as El Popo volcano, has recently started spewing plumes. It is situated in Mexico.
Popocatepetl means “smoking mountain” in the Nahuatl language. After lying dormant for more than 70 years, it has been spewing toxic fumes, ash, and lumps of incandescent rock.

data.question: 1. ‘Atal Bhujal Yojana’, which was seen in the news, is implemented by which Union Ministry?
options: [A] Ministry of MSME[B] Ministry of Jal Shakti[C] Ministry of Commerce and Industry[D] Ministry of Defence
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: B [Ministry of Jal Shakti]
data.hint:
Notes:The Atal Bhujal Yojana (Atal Jal), a central sector water conservation scheme, will continue for an additional two years beyond its original 2025 end date. It is implemented by the Ministry of Jal Shakti.
The major objective of the Scheme is to improve the management of groundwater resources in select water stressed areas in identified states viz. Gujarat, Haryana, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh.

data.question: 2. Which institution released the ‘Forever Toxic: The science on health threats from plastic recycling’?
data.hint:
Notes:The report titled “Forever Toxic: The science on health threats from plastic recycling” was released recently by Greenpeace Philippines. According to this report, recycling can increase the toxicity of plastics.
The report was released ahead of the second session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee to develop a Global Plastics Treaty, being held at Paris, France.

data.question: 3. Which institutions released the ‘Hunger Hotspots –Early warnings on acute food insecurity’ report?
options: [A] World Bank- IMF[B] IMF- WEF[C] FAO- WFP[D] WHO- FAO
data.hint:
Notes:A new report titled “Hunger Hotspots – FAO-WFP early warnings on acute food insecurity” was released recently.
According to this report, Pakistan, Afghanistan and Myanmar are among the hunger hotspots in the world. Acute food insecurity can potentially increase in magnitude and severity for 18 areas in 22 countries.

data.question: 4. Which country has launched USD 17 billion project known as the ‘Route of Development’?
data.hint:
Notes:Iraq presented an ambitious plan to turn itself into a regional transportation hub by developing its road and rail infrastructure, linking Europe with the Middle East.
Once completed, the $17 billion project known as the ‘Route of Development’ would span the length of the country, stretching 1,200 km  from the northern border with Turkiye to the Gulf in the south.

data.question: 5. Which institution released guidelines for Investor Protection Fund (IPF) and Investor Services Fund (ISF)?
data.hint:
Notes:Capital Market Regulator SEBI- the Securities Exchange Board of India has released guidelines for Investor Protection Fund (IPF) and Investor Services Fund (ISF).
These funds are maintained by stock exchanges and depositories. The new changes aim to strengthen investor protection measures and promote financial literacy and participation in the securities market.

data.question: 6. Which institution launched ‘e-Appeal scheme 2023’?
data.hint:
Notes:The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) recently launched “e appeal” scheme announced in the budget.
Its aim is to minimize pendency of appeals related to Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) default issues and tax collection at source (TCS). The scheme empowers the Joint Commissioner (Appeals) for disposing of appeals filed before it or allocated or transferred to it.

data.question: 7. Which city is the host of the ‘International Organic Mahotsav-2023’?
data.hint:
Notes:International Organic Mahotsav-2023 is being organized from June 2 to 4 in Gadiraju Palace in Visakhapatnam.
The Rythu Sadhikara Samstha (RySS) is organising the event, which will connect farmers practicing natural farming methods and potential consumers of these crops.

data.question: 8. As of 2023, India has how many joint logistics nodes?
data.hint:
Notes:The armed forces are planning to set up additional joint logistics nodes across the country to boost integration in their logistical needs and streamline their supply chains.
While the last joint logistics node was operationalised in Mumbai in April 2021, the nodes in Guwahati and Tri-Services, Port Blair were operationalised in January 2021. The Joint Operations Division under the Headquarters Integrated Defence Staff has been responsible for establishing the nodes.

data.question: 9. Which institution accepted the ‘Draft Resolution on the Impact of Chemicals, Waste and Pollution on Human Health’?
data.hint:
Notes:The WHO member countries have recently accepted a draft resolution on the impact of chemicals, waste and pollution on human health during the 76th WHA.
It urged the healthcare sector to develop a regulatory framework, national human bio-monitoring and surveillance programmes to track chemicals that impact human health.

data.question: 10. Which country leads the ‘Combined Maritime Forces’ coalition?
data.hint:
Notes:Combined Maritime Forces is a US-led maritime coalition involved in securing tense Gulf waterways. The UAE recently withdrew from this coalition.
The coalition is tasked with securing tense Gulf waterways that are vital to the global oil trade. The coalition had 38 member states.

data.question: 11. Which institution submitted its report on the sedition law to the law ministry?
options: [A] Election Commission[B] Law Commission[C] Central Vigilance Commission[D] Central Bureau of Investigation
data.hint:
Notes:The 22nd Law Commission submitted its report on the sedition law to the law ministry, providing its recommendations on amending section 124A of the Indian Penal Code.
Earlier, the 21st Law Commission in August 2018 had published a consultation paper seeking public views on the sedition law.

data.question: 12. Which country has approved ‘Debt Ceiling Deal’ to raise the government’s borrowing limit?
data.hint:
Notes:The US Congress has approved the debt ceiling deal to raise the government’s borrowing limit and thwarting a potentially catastrophic default on US debt repayments.
It will allow the federal government to borrow money until after the next presidential election in November 2024. The agreement keeps non-defence spending flat next year, with a 1% rise in 2025.

data.question: 13. Which country unveiled the ‘Obstetric Fistula Strategic Plan’?
data.hint:
Notes:Obstetric fistula is a health condition characterized by the formation of an opening between the passage through which a baby is delivered and the urinary or digestive system.
Zamibia recently unveiled the Obstetric Fistula Strategic Plan for the period 2022 to 2026. On May 23, Zambia commemorated International Day for Elimination of Obstetric Fistula with theme “20 years on — progress but not enough! Act Now to End Fistula by 2030”. As of 2018, more than 33,000 women and girls were affected in the country.

data.question: 14. The United States signed a trade deal with which country, and was warned by China?
data.hint:
Notes:The United States and Taiwan have signed a trade deal aimed at deepening economic relations between both sides in a move that has sparked a warning from China.
Washington and Taipei maintain a multibillion-dollar annual trade and unofficial ties through the de facto US embassy. The Chinese foreign ministry accused Washington of violating agreements on the status of Taiwan.

data.question: 15. Which neighbouring country recorded an annual inflation rate of 37.97% in May 2023?
data.hint:
Notes:Pakistan’s annual inflation rate rose to 37.97% in May, the statistics bureau said, adding to its problems of a balance of payment crisis and the risk of a sovereign default.
In April, the bureau said Pakistan’s CPI at 36.5% was the highest recorded, and this is the national record for the second month in a row.

data.question: 16. Which city is the headquarters of Pharmaceutical Inspection Convention and Pharmaceutical Inspection Co-operation Scheme (PIC/S)?
data.hint:
Notes:India is planning to join the Pharmaceutical Inspection Convention and Pharmaceutical Inspection Co-operation Scheme (PIC/S). It is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.
It is an global regime that promotes cooperation between countries and regulatory authorities in good manufacturing practices (GMP) in order to improve the quality of their medical products.

data.question: 17. Strawberry Moon is the full moon of which month?
data.hint:
Notes:June’s full moon, also known as the Strawberry Moon, rose on June 3. The moon will then reach new moon on June 18, at which point it will be totally lost in the sun’s glare.
The next full moon, July’s Buck Moon, will rise on Monday, July 3.

data.question: 18. What is the name of the portal launched for monitoring the implementation of Centrally Sponsored Schemes of Justice Ministry ?
options: [A] Nyaya Vikas Portal[B] Info Vikas Portal[C] CSS Monitor Portal[D] Bharat Scheme Portal
data.hint:
Notes:Nyaya Vikas Portal was launched recently for monitoring the implementation of Centrally Sponsored Schemes.
It provides information regarding the funding, documentation, project monitoring and approval of these schemes. The Department of Justice has been implementing the Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS) for Development of Infrastructure Facilities for Districts and Subordinate Judiciary since 1993-94.

data.question: 19. What is Sea Ice?
options: [A] Frozen CO2[B] Frozen sea water[C] Frozen salt[D] Frozen sugar
data.hint:
Notes:Sea ice is frozen seawater which floats on the ocean surface. It undergoes a melting process during summer and then re-freezes during the winter season. It forms in both the Arctic and the Antarctic in each hemisphere’s winter.
A new study revealed that Arctic may become sea ice-free in the summers by 2030s.

data.question: 20. ‘Prerna: The Vernacular School’, which was seen in the news, is located in which state?
data.hint:
Notes:Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s first school in Gujarat’s Mehsana district is being developed as a model school called “Prerna” to inspire youth of the country.
In this school, two children from each district in India will be enrolled to spend around a week in the school and they will be trained on how to live a evolved life.

data.question: 21. As per the ‘World Bank’s Latest Global Economic Prospects Report’, what is the growth rate of the global economy in 2023?
data.hint:
Notes:The World Bank’s most recent Global Economic Prospects report predicts that the global economy will experience a growth rate of 2.1% in 2023, compared to 3.1% in 2022.
The report also highlights that trade in 2023 is expected to expand at a significantly slower pace, less than one-third of its pre-pandemic levels.

data.question: 22. Which state commissioned the K-FON Fibre Optic Network Project?
data.hint:
Notes:Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan commissioned the first phase of the Kerala Fibre Optic Network (K-FON).
The project is aimed at providing free Internet access to 20 lakh below poverty line (BPL) families and connecting 30,000 government institutions, as well as providing Internet connection at nominal rate to the public.

data.question: 23. Which Armed Force procured the first barge, LSAM 15 (Yard 125) from a Thane-based private company?
options: [A] Indian Army[B] Indian Navy[C] Indian Air Force[D] Indian Coast Guard
data.hint:
Notes:The first Ammunition Cum Torpedo Cum Missile (ACTCM) barge, LSAM 15 (Yard 125), has been delivered to the Indian Navy recently by the Suryadipta Projects, Thane.
This is in line with the “Aatmanirbhar Bharat” initiatives of the Indian government.

data.question: 24. ‘Espionage Act’ is associated with which country?
data.hint:
Notes:The Espionage Act is a US legislation that was enacted after the First World War to criminalize certain conducts associated with the mishandling of sensitive government records concerning to the national defense.
Former US President Donald Trump has recently become the most high-profile individual to ever face criminal charges under this Act.

data.question: 25. Janan Bushehri, is the only woman legislator elected in which country’s general election?
data.hint:
Notes:Opposition lawmakers won a majority in Kuwait’s parliament with only one woman -Janan Bushehri elected, after the Gulf state’s seventh general election in just over a decade.
Since Kuwait adopted a parliamentary system in 1962, the legislature has been dissolved around a dozen times.

data.question: 26. Which country is the host of this year’s edition of ‘Miss World pageant’?
data.hint:
Notes:Miss World pageant is one of the oldest beauty pageants in the world. The Miss World Organization recently announced that India is the venue for this year’s edition of the event.
Contestants from over 130 countries will showcase their talents, intelligence, and compassion. They will participate in a series of rigorous competitions, including talent showcases, sports challenges, and charitable initiatives etc.

data.question: 27. ADB signed a loan agreement with India for implementing ‘Subtropical Horticulture, Irrigation, and Value Addition Project’ in which state/UT?
options: [A] Assam[B] Gujarat[C] Himachal Pradesh[D] West Bengal
data.hint:
Notes:A USD 130 million loan agreement was signed recently between the Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Indian Government.
The agreement is for the implementation of the Himachal Pradesh Subtropical Horticulture, Irrigation, and Value Addition Project. Its aim is to promote horticulture in the state.

data.question: 28. Which state is the host of the ‘SAI20 Summit’ in India?
data.hint:
Notes:Supreme Audit Institutions (SAI) 20 Summit under India’s G20 Presidency commenced recently in Goa.
The Summit has called upon the Supreme Audit Institutions (SAI) to take measures for suitable integration of artificial intelligence (AI) in audit processes and tasks for improved audit efficiency and effectiveness.

data.question: 29. A celt, belonging to the neolithic period, was recently discovered in which state/UT?
options: [A] Kerala[B] Karnataka[C] Tamil Nadu[D] Andhra Pradesh
data.hint:
Notes:A celt, belonging to the neolithic period, was recently discovered in Poothinatham village in Dharmapuri, Tamil Nadu.
Archaeological excavations are being carried out by Tamil Nadu’s Department of Archaeology in the village. It was a significant discovery as the celt was used as either a plough or an axe, and was made of Doloraid stone.

data.question: 30. Which city hosted the first National Training Conclave?
data.hint:
Notes:Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently inaugurated the first National Training Conclave in New Delhi.
It is an effort by the government aiming to strengthen training infrastructure for civil servants across India. The event was hosted by the Capacity Building Commission (CBC) and is sponsored by the National Programme for Civil Services Capacity Building (NPCSCB) – ‘Mission Karmayogi’.

data.question: 31. What is the outlay for 3 schemes related to disaster management, which were announced by the Government of India, recently?
options: [A] Rs.1000 crore[B] Rs.2000 crore[C] Rs.8000 crore[D] Rs.9000 crore
data.hint:
Notes:The Union Home Minister, has recently announced three schemes worth ₹8,000 crore related to disaster management, which includes modernisation of fire services, flood mitigation in seven major cities and prevention of landslides in 17 states.
It was informed by the Minister, that for modernization and expansion of fire brigade services, about ₹5,000 crore assistance will be given to all States and  to mitigate the danger of floods in urban areas, in seven major cities, ₹2,500 crore will be given.

data.question: 32. Which country has decided to rejoin UNESCO?
data.hint:
Notes:The United States plans to rejoin the U.N. cultural and scientific agency UNESCO and pay more than USD 600 million in back dues.
The officials of U.S. have stated that the country’s decision to return was motivated by concern that China is filling the gap left by the U.S. in UNESCO policymaking, notably in setting standards for artificial intelligence and technology education around the world.

data.question: 33. Which country returned remains of Indigenous Maori and Moriori people to New Zealand?
data.hint:
Notes:The remains of 95 Indigenous New Zealanders as well as artefacts and cultural treasures have been returned to New Zealand from museums and universities in Germany.
The ancestral remains of the 95 Maori and Moriori individuals, including six toi moko – Maori mummified tattooed heads – were welcomed to Te Papa, New Zealand’s national museum.

data.question: 34. Where is the 2025 IIAS (International Institute of Administrative Sciences) annual conference proposed to be held?
data.hint:
Notes:The 2025 IIAS (International Institute of Administrative Sciences) annual conference is proposed to be held in India, at Kochi. The event will be attended by 30 member countries, 18 national sections and over 50 academic institutions.
The International Institute of Administrative Sciences, which is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium, is a federation of member states, national sections and research institutions which elaborate on pubic administration solutions.

data.question: 35. What is the new name of the ‘Nehru Memorial Museum and Library Society’?
options: [A] India Memorial Museum and Library Society[B] Prime Ministers’ Museum and Library Society[C] Swatantra Memorial Museum and Library Society[D] Bharat Memorial Museum and Library Society
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: B [Prime Ministers’ Museum and Library Society]
data.hint:
Notes:During a special meeting of the Nehru Memorial Museum and Library Society, a decision was made to modify its name to the Prime Ministers’ Museum and Library Society.
The meeting was chaired by Rajnath Singh, the Union Defence Minister and Vice-President of the Society.

data.question: 36. ‘Fish kill’ phenomenon was recently recorded in which country?
data.hint:
Notes:‘Fish kill’ refers to the abrupt and unforeseen demise of numerous fish or other aquatic creatures within a limited timeframe, predominantly concentrated in a specific area.
It was recorded recently in Texas. Among the dead fish in the shores, most were menhaden but there were also some sharks, trout, bass, catfish and stingrays.

data.question: 37. Which institution issued Guidelines on Product Offerings by online bond platform providers (OBPP)?
data.hint:
Notes:The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has imposed restrictions on online bond platform providers, prohibiting them from offering products other than listed debt securities.
However, SEBI has allowed these platforms to offer specific securities such as Government Securities, Treasury Bills, listed Sovereign Gold Bonds, listed municipal debt securities, and listed securitized debt instruments.

data.question: 38. Which country has won the title of ‘World Squash Championship’ in 2023?
data.hint:
Notes:Egypt has retained World Squash Championship, after beating Malaysia 2-1 in the final in Chennai.
The third place was shared jointly by hosts India and Japan. India was beaten by Malaysia 3-0 in the semi-final. Eight countries took part in the World Squash Championship.

data.question: 39. Which Asian country approved a bill with the objective for awareness and acceptance of the LGBT community?
data.hint: Notes:Japan recently approved a bill with the objective of fostering awareness and acceptance of the LGBT community. However, concerns have been raised regarding the absence of human rights safeguards in the legislation and the possibility of reinforcing specific forms of discrimination.

data.question: 40. Which country is the host of the ‘Ex Khaan Quest 2023’ multilateral peacekeeping joint exercise?
data.hint:
Notes:Ex Khaan Quest 2023 is a multilateral peacekeeping joint exercise that is currently being held in Mongolia. It involved the participation of military contingents and observers from around 20 countries.
President of Mongolia inaugurated the Exercise, which is co-sponsored by Mongolian Armed Forces (MAF) and United States Army Pacific Command (USARPAC).

data.question: 41. What is the expansion of ‘NIXI’, which celebrated its 20th foundation day recently?
options: [A] National Internet Exchange of India[B] National Information Exchange of India[C] National iOS Exchange of India[D] National Interactive Exchange of India
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: A [National Internet Exchange of India]
data.hint: Notes:National Internet Exchange of India (NIXI) celebrated its 20th foundation day on 19th June this year. NIXI has made remarkable efforts to establish a strong and all-encompassing digital environment in the nation through its various business divisions, which include Internet Exchange, .IN Registry, IRINN, and NIXI-CSC Data Services Ltd.

data.question: 42. What is the name of the plant which grows on another plant/tree drawing moisture and nutrients not from host?
data.hint:
Notes:Epiphytes grow on another plant/tree merely for physical support, drawing moisture and nutrients from the air, rain, water or from debris accumulating around it, and not from the host.
The survival of epiphytic orchids in the Dooars and Darjeeling hills are threatened due to deforestation. They are known for their medicinal properties.

data.question: 43. The Child Helpline 1098 is set to be consolidated with which helpline?
data.hint:
Notes:The Ministry of Women and Child Development had announced the consolidation of the existing child helpline (1098), operated by Childline, with the women’s helpline and Emergency Response Support System (112), as part of its “One Nation, One Helpline” initiative.
Andhra Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Ladakh, Puducherry, Goa, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Mizoram, Gujarat, and Bihar are set to launch the integrated child helpline service by the end of this month, making it the first of its kind in India.

data.question: 44. Which Union Ministry organized the ‘Ocean Ring of Yoga’ special event?
options: [A] Ministry of Defence[B] Ministry of AYUSH[C] Ministry of External Affairs[D] Ministry of Sports
data.hint:
Notes:To commemorate the International Yoga Day 2023, the Ministry of AYUSH has organized a special event called the ‘Ocean Ring of Yoga’ to symbolize unity and solidarity.
As part of this initiative, Indian Navy ships stationed in the Indian Ocean Region are visiting different ports of friendly foreign nations to promote the message of ‘Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam,’ which is also the theme for IDY 23.

data.question: 45. In the recently released ‘Motor Third Party Premium and Liability Rules’, by what percent the premium for third-party motor insurance is increased?
data.hint:
Notes:In the recently released Motor Third Party Premium and Liability Rules (FY) 2023-24 by the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways in consultation with IRDAI, no change is proposed in the premium rates for third-party motor insurance for FY2023-24.
The Government of India has made it mandatory in India for motor vehicles to get a third-party insurance policy under the provisions of Motor Vehicles Act of India, 1988.

data.question: 46. What is the name of the 21-foot submersible which disappeared recently?
data.hint:
Notes:Titan is a 21-foot submersible that disappeared recently. It is operated by OceanGate Expeditions, an undersea exploration company that has been making yearly voyages to the Titanic since 2021.
As per the authorities, the submersible suffered a “catastrophic implosion,” killing all five people on board while descending to explore the wreckage of the famous ship.

data.question: 47. Which concept states that black holes are not completely black but emit a form of radiation over time?
options: [A] CV Raman radiation[B] Hawking radiation[C] Newton radiation[D] Einstein radiation
data.hint:
Notes:Hawking radiation is a theoretical concept in physics proposed by the renowned physicist Stephen
Hawking. It suggests that black holes are not completely black but emit a form of radiation over time. Chinese researchers have utilized quantum computing to simulate black hole physics and test Stephen Hawking’s theory on Hawking radiaation.

data.question: 48. Joha rice, which was seen in the news, is from which state/UT?
data.hint:
Notes:Scientists at the Institute of Advanced Study in Science and Technology conducted research on the nutraceutical properties of Joha rice, an aromatic rice grown in the Northeastern region of India, especially Assam.
They found that Joha rice is effective in reducing blood glucose levels and preventing the onset of diabetes, making it a promising choice for managing diabetes.

data.question: 49. ‘Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah mosque’ is located in which country?
data.hint:
Notes:Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to tour the Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah mosque, situated in Cairo, Egypt. It is named after Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah (985-1021), the 16th Fatimid Caliph.
As the fourth oldest mosque in Egypt and the second largest, it holds significant historical and architectural importance.

data.question: 50. ‘Blue Pansy (Junonia Orithya)’ has been named as the official butterfly of which state/UT?
options: [A] Karnataka[B] Jammu and Kashmir[C] Arunachal Pradesh[D] Sikkim
data.hint:
Notes:Blue Pansy (Junonia Orithya) has been named the official butterfly of Jammu and Kashmir. The Blue Pansy, a type of vivid blue butterfly, can be observed in different regions of Southeast Asia, Australia, and Africa.
These butterflies, recognized for their territorial behavior, display 26 distinct local subspecies within their habitat.

data.question: 1. Which bloc has conducted a joint military drill named ‘Solidarity Exercise’?
data.hint:
Notes:‘Solidarity exercise’ is a joint military drill involving the ASEAN nations -Indonesia, Vietnam, Malaysia, Brunei and the Philippines.
This year, Indonesia holds the rotating chair of the regional bloc. The military exercise has been planned amid the tensions with China.

data.question: 2. Honeybee hives in which country faced the second highest mortality rate ever recorded?
data.hint:
Notes:According to a recent survey by the University of Maryland and Auburn University, honeybee hives in the US faced the second highest mortality rate ever recorded, with beekeepers losing almost half of their managed colonies.
However, the survey also revealed that the total number of honeybee colonies in the country has remained relatively steady, despite this significant loss.

data.question: 3. Which company introduced ‘Perspectives’ tab feature, which allows users to explore diverse viewpoints on a particular topic?
data.hint: Notes:Google, owned by Alphabet, introduced the ‘Perspectives’ tab feature, which allows users to explore diverse viewpoints on a particular topic. By selecting the filter, users can access a range of content such as videos from platforms like TikTok and YouTube, written posts from discussion boards and social media, and more, as explained in a blog post by Google.

data.question: 4. Which company is set to buy the Danske Bank’s IT centre in India?
options: [A] HDFC Bank[B] Infosys[C] Axis Bank[D] Tata Consultancy Services
data.hint:
Notes:Infosys has announced a long-term collaboration with Danske Bank. The projected agreement worth USD 454 million for a 5-year term has the possibility to renew for an extra year up to three times.
As part of this agreement, Infosys will also buy Danske Bank’s IT centre in India, which employs over 1,400 people. Danske Bank, headquartered in Denmark, provides banking services to individuals and businesses, as well as large corporations and institutions.

data.question: 5. Which institution leads the ‘Trans-Asia Railway (TAR) network’?
data.hint:
Notes:The Asian Development Bank (ADB) is set to provide 400 million US dollars in loans to Bangladesh for the construction of 102 kilometers long dual gauge railways between Chattogram and Cox’s Bazar to promote trade, investment and tourism.
Chattogram-Cox’s Bazar Railway is part of the Trans-Asia Railway (TAR) network, an initiative led by the United Nations, aiming to provide seamless rail links between Asia and Europe to better connect people and markets.

data.question: 6. Which state/UT hosted the ‘Vitasta’ program to spread its art culture and literature?
options: [A] Odisha[B] West Bengal[C] Jammu and Kashmir[D] Jharkhand
data.hint:
Notes:The Vitasta program was conducted with the aim of spreading the diverse art, culture, literature, craft, and cuisine of Kashmir to every corner of the country.
This series of events, which commenced in Chennai and concluded in Srinagar, witnessed a remarkable level of interest among the youth in understanding and embracing the vibrant Kashmiri culture.

data.question: 7. Which country has been removed from UNGA Security Council Children and Armed Conflict Report?
data.hint:
Notes:Since 2010, India has been included in the report of the Secretary-General on Children and armed conflict, alongside other countries such as Burkina Faso, Cameroon, the Lake Chad basin, Nigeria, Pakistan, and the Philippines.
As a result of the government’s efforts to enhance the protection of children, India is presently not mentioned in the United Nations General Assembly Security Council Children and Armed Conflict Report of the Secretary-General.

data.question: 8. Which state/UT is associated with ‘EKAMRA project’?
data.hint:
Notes:Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik initiated the Rs 280-crore EKAMRA project, aimed at enhancing the surroundings of the 11th-century Lingaraj Temple in Bhubaneswar, as part of his government’s commitment to the development of ancient temples.
Launched in 2019, the EKAMRA plan focuses on revitalizing approximately 80 acres of land surrounding the historic Lord Shiva shrine in the Ekamra Kshetra (ancient name of Bhubaneswar).

data.question: 9. Bald eagle is endemic to which part of the world?
data.hint:
Notes:The bald eagle is a bird of prey and a sea eagle found in North America. It is the national bird of USA. In 2007, the American bald eagle was taken off the endangered species list in the United States. Since then, there has been a consistent increase in the population of these birds.
According to a report by the US Fish and Wildlife Service in 2021, the number of bald eagles in their natural habitat has multiplied by four since 2009.

data.question: 10. When is the International Day of Parliamentarism observed by the United Nations?
data.hint:
Notes:June 30 marks the annual celebration of the International Day of Parliamentarism which commemorates the founding of the Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU) in 1889.
This special day was established by a United Nations General Assembly Resolution in 2018 to reflect on the progress made by parliaments worldwide in achieving predetermined goals.

data.question: 11. Which Indian Institution is working on the development of a secure signaling system for the Indian Railways, by using block chain technology?
options: [A] ISRO[B] DRDO[C] IIT Kharagpur[D] Indian Army
data.hint:
Notes:The Indian Institute of Technology – Kharagpur, is working on the development of a secure signaling system for the Indian Railways, utilizing blockchain technology.
This tamper-proof system will incorporate advanced safety features and serve as a complement to the existing Data Logger, commonly known as the ‘Black Box,’ used in rolling stock.

data.question: 12. Which Union Ministry launched the ‘eSARAS mobile App’?
options: [A] Ministry of Rural Development[B] Ministry of MSME[C] Ministry of Power[D] Ministry of External Affairs
data.correctAnswer: Correct Answer: A [Ministry of Rural Development]
data.hint:
Notes:The Deendayal Antyodaya Yojna- National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM) has introduced the eSARAS mobile App, aimed at enhancing marketing assistance for products created by women belonging to Self-help Groups (SHGs).
